{"step_by_step_thinking": "The SCL 90-R (Symptom Checklist 90 Revised) is a psychological test instrument. It is used to measure psychological symptoms and psychological distress. The obsessive-compulsive dimension of the SCL 90-R is designed to identify symptoms related to obsessive-compulsive disorder, such as recurrent and persistent thoughts, impulses, or images that are intrusive and cause marked anxiety or distress. However, it is not specifically designed to identify cognitive impairments, which refer to difficulties with mental abilities such as memory, attention, problem-solving, etc.", "answer_choice": "B. no"}
